```{=html}
<section id="pos" class="scroll-block snap position-section">
  <div class="hover-card">
    <h2>Our Position</h2>
    <p>
      Every health professional must learn how to provide quality health care to people with intellectual disability because everyone has the right to
      <span class="kw" tabindex="0">safe</span>,
      <span class="kw" tabindex="0">respectful</span>,
      <span class="kw" tabindex="0">effective</span> and
      <span class="kw" tabindex="0">inclusive</span>
      health care.
    </p>
  </div>
</section>
```


<section id= "prob" class="scroll-block snap">
  <div class="hover-card">
  <h2>The Problem</h2>
  <p>
    People with intellectual disability experience some of the poorest health outcomes in Australia. Many of these outcomes are preventable with better access to inclusive, high-quality care.
  </p>

  <p>
    As the document notes, <em class="scroll-highlight">“University courses teach very little, if anything, about intellectual disability…”</em> and most health professionals are not required to complete training in this area.
  </p>

  <p>
    This gap leaves much of the workforce underprepared to deliver accessible and equitable care.
  </p>
  </div>
</section>

<section id= "sol" class="scroll-block snap">
  <div class="hover-card">
  <h2>The Solution</h2>
  <p>
    Better education and training is one of the top requests made by people with intellectual disability. The Position Statement calls for a coordinated national approach to upskill today’s and tomorrow’s health workforce.
  </p>

  <p>
    Training must be grounded in human rights, reflect lived experience, encourage self-reflection, and align with best-practice person-centred care.
  </p>

  <p>
    As Lucy, a project worker with lived experience, says:
    <em>“All health workers need to respect people with intellectual disability and treat them with fairness…”</em>
  </p>
  </div>
</section>

```{=html}
<section id="rec" class="scroll-block snap rec-section">
  <div class="rec-wrap">
    <!-- LEFT: sticky board -->
    <div class="rec-board" aria-label="Recommendations board">
      <h2>Key Recommendations</h2>

      <div class="board-surface">
        <ul class="stickers" id="stickers">
          <li class="sticker">Make intellectual disability education compulsory in all tertiary health courses.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Increase opportunities for clinical and non-clinical placements involving people with intellectual disability.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Actively involve people with intellectual disability and their support networks in designing and delivering training.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Require intellectual disability training for all health professionals in public hospitals and emergency services.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Ensure peak bodies and specialist colleges promote CPD opportunities.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Embed intellectual disability content in specialty training curricula.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Expand high-quality training and advanced pathways for those who wish to specialise.</li>
          <li class="sticker">Provide health professionals with the time, resources and support needed to apply their training.</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
```

<script>
(function () {
  const sections = document.querySelectorAll(".snap:not(.cover-hero)");
  if (!sections.length) return;

  const obs = new IntersectionObserver((entries) => {
    entries.forEach((e) => {
      // intersectionRatio is 0..1
      const r = e.intersectionRatio;

      e.target.style.opacity = r;
      e.target.style.transform = `translateY(${20 - 20 * r}px)`;
    });
  }, {
    threshold: Array.from({length: 101}, (_, i) => i / 100)
  });

  sections.forEach(s => obs.observe(s));
})();
</script>

<script>
(function(){
  const dots = document.querySelectorAll(".rail-dot");
  const sections = ["pos","prob","sol","rec","how","glos"]
    .map(id => document.getElementById(id))
    .filter(Boolean);

  if(!sections.length || !dots.length) return;

  const dotMap = new Map();
  dots.forEach(d => dotMap.set(d.dataset.target, d));

  const obs = new IntersectionObserver((entries) => {
    entries.forEach(e => {
      if(e.isIntersecting){
        dots.forEach(d => d.classList.remove("active"));
        const id = e.target.id;
        const dot = dotMap.get(id);
        if(dot) dot.classList.add("active");
      }
    });
  }, { threshold: 0.55 });

  sections.forEach(s => obs.observe(s));
})();
</script>

<script>
const highlights = document.querySelectorAll('.scroll-highlight');

const observer = new IntersectionObserver(entries => {
  entries.forEach(entry => {
    if (entry.isIntersecting) {
      entry.target.classList.remove('active');
      void entry.target.offsetWidth; // force reflow
      entry.target.classList.add('active');
    }
  });
}, {
  threshold: 0.6
});

highlights.forEach(el => observer.observe(el));
</script>
<script>
(function () {
  const section = document.querySelector("#rec");
  if (!section) return;

  const stickers = Array.from(section.querySelectorAll(".sticker"));
  const steps = Array.from(section.querySelectorAll(".rec-step"));
  if (!stickers.length || !steps.length) return;

  const obs = new IntersectionObserver((entries) => {
    entries.forEach((entry) => {
      const idx = steps.indexOf(entry.target);
      if (idx < 0) return;

      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        stickers[idx].classList.add("is-on");  // control for sticker on/off
      } 
    });
  }, { threshold: 0.6 });

  steps.forEach(s => obs.observe(s));
})();
</script>
